caption: This is a really beautiful church dedicated to our Lady of the Miraculous medal. I went there on a Sunday and it was packed with people praying directly on the altar. They closed it up at 1pm and it only has specific hours to visit so check before you go.

Tucked away inside a small alley is the Chapel of Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal, dedicated to the divine apparition of Virgin Mary to St. Catherine where the Virgin Mary requested the creation of the miraculous medal. Constructed by an imperial decree of King Louis XVIII, the chapel also stores the incorruptible body of St. Catherine just beside the altar. Mostly visited by people on pilgrimage, it's a worthy short stop for everyone, with a beautiful interior inside the chapel chamber. Just use proper attire and don't be loud as people are praying here. Outside there's a souvenir shop selling the infamous gold & blue medal, hence the name.

This sacred Marina shrine and chapel is a beautiful and serene place, is a must see in Paris if you are a devout a catholic. But even as just a tourist with interests in art and architecture, this place is definitely worth visiting. It‚Äôs a short walk from several other attractions nearby in the center of Paris.  When we got there in the evening, a mass was just concluding and so we got to experience a small part of it and then take our time to see the different parts of this exquisite chapel. There is also a nice gift shop and the sisters at the entrance were very cordial and explained details about the chapel.  When you walk in the corridor towards the entrance to the chapel, there is a lovely display of the apparition of November 27, 1830, all along the wall on the left, and some sculptures, including one of St.Vincent de Paul.

Chapel that represents an intrinsic religiosity, from the entrance. It remains in the time when Saint Catherine Labour√© lived in the convent. At the end, there is a shop with products being sold in the main languages of the world. It is a mandatory stop for Christians visiting Paris.
I loved the history and story of this church and the devotion of the people that were attending the mass. I liked the blue theme also, very holy place with people from so many different backgrounds.
What a spiritual experience of peace and encounter with God. Definitely the Blessed Virgin Mary was present there.
Very spiritual place. It is possible to do a confession if you take the time to wait for your turn. There is a shop to buy the famous medal before you reach the entrance of the Chapel

There is no wait time to enter the Chapel. It is open to all but we are encouraged to dress moderately while we visit. At the reception you would be given a pamphlet that tells you all about the chapel‚Äôs origin, founder, architectural design and the message of faith, hope and love in different language‚Äî  It has a souvenir shop where you can spend as little as 25 cents for leaflets. The souvenir shop also has the miraculous medals designed in different ways. There are rosaries, Novena prayer leaflets and books available in different languages. Also if you visit in the evening when there's no mass going on, you may join the sisters in their vespers. It gives such a happy feeling. Above all, the chapel is accessible with platforms for persons who might have reduced mobility.

It is a place so special that the divinity and deep faith are palpable so that it gets filled to capacity all the time. It is one where you clearly see people with tremendous faith and devotion to the blessed mother of God come to pray or attend a mass to ask for a favor or simply enjoy the architecture or music as they have a beautiful chorus, a particular young lady with angelic voice, and employees who love and serve in the Chapelle, whose devotion veneration and love are also palpable. While in France, please pay a special visit at minimum you can enjoy the story that dates back or even if you are not of the faith with luck, grace, or a special blessing you may or will become a faithful life long devotee!

Beautiful church with historical significance.  One can feel the unique atmosphere when In the church.  My intention of coming here was to view the  incorruptible body of St Catherine.  It's a divine feeling, hard to describe or put into words.  There is also a shop attached to the church which sells rosaries, medals , prayer books amongst others.

Beautiful church, awash with tourists but still a functioning church. We attended mass for the first sunday of advent here. Mass is said in french and in places latin was used for some chants but if you are a practicing catholic its not too hard to follow.

I was raised a Roman Catholic and consecrated to the Blessed Virgin Mary at my First Holy Communion. I bear one of Her titles ‚ÄúConcepci√≥n‚Äù as did my Mother and Grandmother. (RIPüåπ). I wear THE Miraculous Medal. My trip to Paris was a pilgrimage to the city dedicated to the Virgin. Run by the Daughters of Charity, it is a quiet respite from the busy streets. Attended morning Mass.

The chapel was very beautiful I was very moved and cried. Luckily I arrived right before Mass and I was able to attend. There‚Äôs a gift shop too but closed at the time after Mass so I had to return later at night.

It is a destination for pilgrimages & those who want to see shrines. Architecture was decent, but it is all about the visions of Katharine of Mother Mary. LeBourey is an incorruptible saint & essentially lies "in state" on the right side of the altar. There are daily masses. No flash photos & quite/silence is highly requested.
Hidden church in the center of Paris. In 1830 Sister Catherine saw Mother Mary who provided her with the description of the Miraculous Medal that gives the name to the church.
A lot of praying people, many attendees of the every weekday Holy Mass at 10.30. A place of pray and silence. Definately worth of spending some time there!
For me, knowing the story of the Miraculous Medal since I was a child, it is mandatory to visit this place. Located in the heart of Paris while walking around, you can pass by.

Thought provoking. Seeing the incorrupt body of St. Catherine Laboure right before your eyes makes your Faith in the living God stronger. Incorruptibility of the human body is one of the results of one‚Äôs faith in HIM!  Apparitions of the Virgin Mary is one proof of her motherhood and how she loves us and her desire to intercede for us as her children!  St Catherine of Laboure of the DC (Daughters of Charity) Congregation was the visionary who was instructed by the Virgin Mary in several apparitions, to have a medal struck depicting the exact second apparition. With the help of her spiritual confessor, who,after two long years, finally believed her, the priest was able to later persuade the bishop of the apparition and the Virgin Mary‚Äôs request to have a medal made.  During St. Catherine‚Äôs evening meditations, after the Virgin Mary‚Äôs second apparition, She showed herself inside an oval frame, standing upon a globe with rays of light coming from her hands toward the globe. Around the frame were the words,  ‚ÄúO Mary, conceived without sin, pray for us who have recourse to thee."  The first 2000 medals started the worldwide devotion.  When you want to hear mass in English though, check their schedule online! Remember, the chapel is small and the number of church-goers are limited at a time. You will have to stand in queue outside the DC premises which, by the way, is surrounded by famous brand stores.  I suggest you look up several articles online so you will know more about the life of St Catherine Laboure and her humility. She never, by the way, revealed to her fellow DC Nuns that she was the visionary. It was only at her death bed that she revealed to her mother superior that she was the visionary.

One of the most peaceful and spiritual place in the centre of noisy Paris. Not easy to find as it is not visible like other churches with big domes. This is a hidden jewel not to miss. I would stress that this is more a spiritual place than touristic.
Amazing place! And as a Catholic, I really appreciate the private space for prayer and privacy apart from the visitors who purely wish to look at the architecture. 10/10
Our dream come true! So beautiful,  so Sacred, so spiritual! Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal pray for us!

I love this Chapel üòç. It is in the heart of Paris, and one can easily see two saints relics incuding that of St. Catherine of Laboure in the church.  The mass is phenomenal, especially on Mariam feast day. Also, indulgence abounds for pilgrims, especially on our Lady's feast days. Confession is heard every day in different languages.
U can buy the medals. Blessed. Closed between 1 and 2.30 pm
This is the shrine of Saint Catherine Laboure, who is credited  with the Miraculous Medal.  Encourage everyone to research her life journey. A must see if you are in Paris

Very beautiful and personal moment. Once you buy the medals at the shop, you have to get them sanctified by the priest at the entrance, it's free and you just have to knock at the door and ask, it takes 2 minutes üôèüíñ
Love the chapel and the mesmerizing beauty of the BVM. Religious items are of quality, specially the high end medals.

Most people know this little oasis of peace as Rue du Bac. Other than St. Catherine Laboure famously known for receiving vision for the Miraculous Medal, there are two other Saints here,  the relic of St Vincent de Paul and the co founder St. Louise de Marillac. A prayerful place which many pious locals and visitors come to pray and participate in Mass.
It‚Äôs a solemn place.No ticket needed to enter the church.  The store is well organized and the sisters in cashier are awesome.

The Chapel of Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal in Paris is truly a blessed sanctuary that transcends religious boundaries. Nestled in the heart of the city, this sacred space welcomes visitors from all walks of life, regardless of their faith.  As a Catholic, I found solace and reverence in the chapel's tranquil atmosphere. The devotion to Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal is palpable, and it's a place where prayers are offered with sincerity and hope. However, even if you're not Catholic, the chapel's beauty and serenity make it a worthwhile destination for reflection and contemplation.  Whether you're seeking spiritual guidance, a moment of quiet introspection, or simply wish to admire the stunning architecture, the Chapel of Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal offers all of this and more. I highly recommend paying a visit during your time in Paris. It's an experience that will leave a lasting impression on your heart and soul.
A must-visit pilgrimage point in Paris for Catholics.
This place has an undescribable energy. It is beautiful and very, very special - and the story behind Catherine Labour√© is impressive and humbling at the same time.
Wonderful to experience Mass in this church

It has rich history, part of the building was donated by Napoleon during the time he needed his injured troops to be nursed and the Daughters of Charity who were nurses by professional rendered the services.
The entrance is free, you can see a beautiful church, has an information center.

Beautiful chapel near the department store Bon March√©. The gate is not large and one can easily missed it. But once stepped inside, the alley opens up and is wonderfully decorated. The chapel holds regular services which are attended by faithfuls in the neighborhood. It‚Äôs a wonderful sanctuary to step in to pray and worship in a busy neighborhood.
Travel from near and far to make a pilgrimage here!

My favorite place to visit. Not for tourists but super meaningful for devotees of Mother Mary. You will be able to see St Catherine's body in perfect condition after all these years. Small shop sells medallions which you can give as presents. Worth the extra visit
Beautiful chapel. Mass was beautiful and had things blessed by a priest when finished in the gift shop
